Key Match Events: Canada held France to a 0-0 draw in a highly impressive performance
Maxime Crépeau made four excellent saves on chances that seemed destined for the goal
Ismaël Koné was excellent in the midfield, winning eight out of 13 ground duels and having 93 per cent passing accuracy
Pre-Game Insights: France went with a strong lineup, including Eduardo Camavinga and Ousmane Dembélé
Didier Deschamps made a trio of changes from the side that beat Luxembourg midweek
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch praised the team's performance, saying they 'look to have taken in more of my ideas from just a few more training sessions'
Marsch also mentioned that the team has a couple of days off before they reconvene to prepare for their next match against Argentina
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in Bordeaux, France
The Canadian team's performance was their best in over a year
The team's patience and possession play were key factors in their success
Others: Maxime Crépeau was named the CanPL.ca Player of the Match
Ismaël Koné and centre-backs Moïse Bombito and Derek Cornelius stood out as well in the team's performance
